solution_line_template: The cost for {num_kindergarten} Kindergarten shirts x ${cost_kindergarten} = $<<{num_kindergarten}*{cost_kindergarten}={kindergarten_total}>>{kindergarten_total}.
The cost for {num_first} first grade shirts x ${cost_first} = $<<{num_first}*{cost_first}={first_total}>>{first_total}.
The cost for {num_second} second grade shirts x ${cost_second} = $<<{num_second}*{cost_second}={second_total}>>{second_total}.
The cost for {num_third} third grade shirts x ${cost_third} = $<<{num_third}*{cost_third}={third_total}>>{third_total}.

The total cost of the shirts was ${kindergarten_total} + ${first_total} + ${second_total} + ${third_total} = $<<{kindergarten_total}+{first_total}+{second_total}+{third_total}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
